Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • Room

  • public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Room - a room in an adventure game. This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game. A "Room" represents one location in the scenery of the game. It is connected to other rooms via exits. For each existing exit, the room stores a reference to the neighboring room.
    Version:
    2006.03.30, A3 Solution, march 7,2019
    Author:
    Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes, Lynn Marshall, Agina Oghenemena Benaiah

    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        public Room(java.lang.String description)
        Create a room described "description". Initially, it has no exits. "description" is something like "a kitchen" or "an open court yard".
        Parameters:
        description - The room's description.

        public void addItem(Item item)
        Add an item to the room, best to check that it's not null.
        Parameters:

      • checkForCookie

        public boolean checkForCookie()
        Try to see if there is a cookie in a room
        Returns:
        Returns true if there's a cookie and false if there's no cookie

        public boolean comparingItemName(java.lang.String secondBookName)
        checks if there's an item in the room
        Parameters:
        secondBookName - Holds the items name in a room
        Returns:
        Returns true if the item is in the room or false if not found

      • getCookie

        public int getCookie()
        Get the index of the cookie in a room
        Returns:
        Returns the index of the cookie (-1 if not found)

      • getExit

        public Room getExit(java.lang.String direction)
        Return the room that is reached if we go from this room in direction "direction". If there is no room in that direction, return null.
        Parameters:
        direction - The exit's direction
        Returns:
        The room in the given direction

      • getItemName

        public Item getItemName(java.lang.String secondBookName)
        Gets the name of an item in a room
        Parameters:
        secondBookName - Holds the items name in a room
        Returns:
        Returns the item the player picks or null if the item is not in the room

      • getLongDescription

        public java.lang.String getLongDescription()
        Return a long description of the room in the form: You are in the kitchen. Exits: north west Items: a chair weighing 5 kgs. a table weighing 10 kgs.
        Returns:
        A long description of this room
